sorular.soru: At the intersection, you turn left and then drive straight ahead. In which situation are you pre-sorting correctly?

feedback.metin: You are pre-sorted correctly in the upper right situation, and both situations at the bottom. In the upper left situation you use the left lane to turn left when there is no reason to do so. You are supposed to drive on the right as much as possible, as in the upper right situation. In the bottom left situation there is no reason to get into the left lane. In the bottom right situation there is, because in this case you can overtake the (slower) lorry.

sorular.soru: To whom should you give way if they approach from the right at an equivalent intersection?

feedback.metin: Someone on rollerblades falls under the category of pedestrians, just like someone who is walking with a bicycle. A horse rider or handler of horses and livestock falls under the category of drivers. The horse's handler therefore also has priority if they approach from the right at an equivalent intersection.
